title: Why publishers shouldn’t trust Facebook News
text: Are we really doing this again? After the pivot to video.

title: Facebook's libra may not be approved, but one expert says something similar could emerge
text: The probability of a global digital currency being created, either by the private sector or a group of central banks, is now higher, the president of a European think tank told CNBC.

title: Facebook is one company that controls billions of people, run by one person
text: Recode co-founder Kara Swisher discusses Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's testimony yesterday on Capitol Hill. She also talks about libra and the responsibility of Big Tech.

title: Here's what you need to know about Facebook's controversial Libra cryptocurrency
text: The project has run into headwinds.

title: With Congress fixated on Facebook, China has taken the cryptocurrency lead
text: Congress would rather torpedo Libra than create a framework to advance the cryptocurrency community.

title: 7 Earnings Reports to Watch
text: These seven earnings reports next week are worth highlighting. Here's what you might expect when each of these companies report earnings.

title: Facebook Crypto Plan on Rocky Ground: ETFs Under Pressure
text: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg sees regulatory hurdle for Libra project. This has hit the crypto space hard, which in turn may build pressure on these ETFs.

title: Congress Remains Puzzled By Facebook’s Motivations For Libra After Zuckerberg Testifies
text: Mark Zuckerberg never clearly explained how Facebook is expecting to profit from libra, and, if the project isn’t about money, why it’s taking on such a complex project at all.

title: Galaxy Digital CEO Michael Novogratz on bitcoin and Facebook's Libra
text: Michael Novogratz, Galaxy Digital CEO and chairman, joins "Squawk Box" to discuss bitcoin prices and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's performance on Capitol Hill, where he was grilled by lawmakers on his plans to introduce a digital currency.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg on the Hill: What's at Stake?
text: Jon Fortt sits down with The New York Times' Farhad Manjoo and John Stanton, co-founder of the Save Journalism Project, to discuss Mark Zuckerberg's congressional testimony on Facebook's libra project.

title: Zuckerberg said Facebook helped Black Lives Matter. Activists disagree and are bracing for 2020
text: Mark Zuckerberg last week invoked Black Lives Matter in explaining why he believes it's so important to allow free expression on Facebook. But real black activists remember how Facebook allowed its platforms to be used to take advantage of BLM and African Americans, standing by as Russian trolls created fake pages and events and allowing for the biggest BLM page on the site to be a scam run out of Australia. They don't trust Facebook to stop that from happening again and so they are taking the fight into their own hands.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg Fails To Ease Lawmaker Concerns With Congressional Testimony
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg spoke in front of the U.S. House Financial Services Committee on Wednesday to better explain his Libra cryptocurrency ambitions.

title: Sen. Mike Rounds defends crypto, saying 'lack of information is driving the mistrust'
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg faced tough questions from legislators on Wednesday regarding libra, data privacy and more. In a letter to the Anchorage Trust Company, Sen. Mike Rounds (R-S.D.) expressed concern over the regulatory crackdown on cryptocurrency. He joins "Squawk Box" to discuss.

title: Facebook user engagement has declined because of other platforms, says Activate co-founder
text: A new study from Activate suggests the average user engagement with Facebook has dropped dramatically.

title: Rep. Patrick McHenry (R-NC): 'Libra is likely to happen'
text: Ranking Member of the House Financial Services Committee Patrick McHenry joined  Yahoo Finance's Jessica Smith to discuss  Libra and the testimony of Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg before the House Financial Services Committee.

title: Rep. Maxine Waters (D-CA) discusses Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg Libra testimony on Capitol Hill
text: Congresswoman Maxine Waters shared her thoughts with Yahoo FInance's Jessica Smith on Faceboook CEO's testimony before the House Financial Services Committee.

title: Rep. Gooden on Zuckerberg testimony: Facebook is dealing with issues they've never had to before
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg faced tough questions from legislators on Wednesday regarding libra, data privacy and more.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is challenged on freedom of expression by Rep. Himes (D-CT)
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg testifies in front of the U.S. House Committee on Financial Services at Capitol Hill on Libra. Democratic U.S. Representative Jim A. Hines questions Zuckerberg about what investment Facebook has made so that freedom of expression can be allowed.

title: Rep. Sherman (D-CA) Facebook's Libra helps, 'drug dealers, terrorists and tax evaders'
text: Congressman Brad Sherman had harsh words for Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook's Libra as he sat before House Financial Services Committee on Capitol Hill.

title: Fischer: Lawmakers didn't spend enough time pressing Zuckerberg on Libra
text: Sara Fischer, Axios media reporter, offers analysis regaring Mark Zuckerberg's congressional hearing on Libra and Facebook.

title: Facebook's Libra is probably not going to be allowed: CEPR | Street Signs Asia
text: The probability of an official digital currency being created is now higher than before, says Beatrice Weder di Mauro of the Centre for Economic Policy Research.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg questioned on Capitol Hill over cryptocurrency Libra
text: CNBC's Elizabeth Schulze has more.

title: What Do Facebook Investors Know That the Policymakers Don’t?
text: Investors are ignoring the noise. While Zuckerberg spoke, FB stock rose 2%.
